readValueAsynchronously

public void readValueAsynchronously(IProcessVariableAddress processVariableAddress,
                                    ValueType valueType,
                                    IProcessVariableValueListener listener)
Asynchronously reads a value from the channel addressed by the the given process variable address. When the value was received, the IProcessVariableValueListener#valueChanged(Object) method will be called on the given listener.

Specified by:
readValueAsynchronously in interface IProcessVariableConnectionService
Parameters:
processVariableAddress - the process variable address
valueType - the expected value type
listener - the call-back listener

register

public void register(IProcessVariableValueListener listener,
                     IProcessVariableAddress pv,
                     ValueType valueType)
Starts listening permanently on the channel addressed by the specified process variable address. The corresponding channel will be open as long as any permanent listener is alive. For convenience this service references the specified listener only weakly which means that it will be garbage collected when its no longer referenced outside this service. If you want to stop listening explicitly please use the IProcessVariableConnectionService.unregister(IProcessVariableValueListener) method. To stop listening just Use the IProcessVariableConnectionService.unregister(IProcessVariableValueListener)

Specified by:
register in interface IProcessVariableConnectionService
Parameters:
listener - the listener that will receive the value change notifications
pv - the process variable address
valueType - the expected value type

unregister

public void unregister(IProcessVariableValueListener listener)
Stops the specified permanent listener.

Specified by:
unregister in interface IProcessVariableConnectionService
Parameters:
listener - the listener
